body.p: The XML Refactoring tool is presented in the form of as an easy to use wizard that is designed to reduce the time and effort required to perform various structure management tasks. For example, you can insert, delete, or rename an attribute in all instances of a particular element that is found in all documents within your project.

To access the tool, select the XML Refactoring... action from one of the following locations:
The ToolsXML Tools menu.
The Refactoring submenu from the contextual menu in the ProjectNavigator view.
The Refactoring submenu from the contextual menu in the DITA Maps Manager view.

The tool includes the following dialog boxes:
Refactoring Operations This dialog box displays, and allows you to select, the available operations, which are grouped by category. To search for an operation, you can use the filter text box at the top of the dialog box.
Configure Operation Parameters This dialog box allows you to specify the parameters for the refactoring operation. The parameters are specific to the type of refactoring operation that is being performed. For example, to delete an attribute you need to specify the parent element and the qualified name of the attribute to be removed.
Scope and Filters The Scope section of this dialog box allows you to select the scope of the set of files that represent the input of the operation. You can select from predefined resource sets (such as the current file, your whole project, the current DITA Map hierarchy, etc.) or you can define your own set of resources by creating a working set. The Filters section includes the following options:
Include files - Allows you to filter the selected resources by using a file pattern. For example, to restrict the operation to only analyze build files you could use "build*.xml" for the file pattern.
Restrict only to known XML file types - When enabled, only resources with a known XML file type will be affected by the operation.
Look inside archives - When enabled, the resources inside archives will also be affected.

p.note: It is recommended that you use the Preview button to review all the changes that will be made by the refactoring operation before implementing the changes. After clicking the Finish button, the operation will be processed and any Undo action will only revert changes on the current document. If the scope of an operation is ProjectEnclosing project and it takes longer than expected to process after clicking the Preview button, you can use the Stop button in the progress bar to stop the operation.

body.p: It is considered best practice to run a validation check after all XML refactoring operations that affect multiple files. To validate all possible affected files, right-click on the root project folder in the ProjectNavigator view and select one of the actions in the Validate submenu or click the Validate and Check for Completeness button on the toolbar of the DITA Maps Manager.
